name: Tim Berners-Lee
shortbio: Sir Timothy John Berners-Lee, also known as TimBL, is an English computer scientist, best known as the inventor of the World Wide Web.
quote: We need diversity of thought in the world to face the new challenges.

name: Edsger Wybe Dijkstra
shortbio: Edsger Wybe Dijkstra was a Dutch computer scientist[14] and an early pioneer in many research areas of computing science.
quote: There should be no such thing as boring mathematics.

name: James Arthur Gosling
shortbio: James Arthur Gosling is a Canadian computer scientist, best known as the creator of the Java programming language.
quote: I think it would be a tragic statement of the universe if Java was the last language that swept through.

name: Dennis MacAlistair Ritchie
shortbio: Dennis MacAlistair Ritchie  was an American computer scientist. He created the C programming language and, with long-time colleague Ken Thompson, the Unix operating system.
quote: When I read commentary about suggestions for where C should go, I often think back and give thanks that it wasn't developed under the advice of a worldwide crowd.

name: Alan Turing
shortbio: Alan Mathison Turing was an English computer scientist, mathematician, logician, cryptanalyst and theoretical biologist.
quote: A computer would deserve to be called intelligent if it could deceive a human into believing that it was human.

name: Linus Benedict Torvalds
shortbio: Linus Benedict Torvalds is a Finnish software engineer who is the creator and, for a long time, principal developer, of the Linux kernel.
quote: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.
